body:
First of all, I think you should have a re-look at your design. When the user tries to log in through the app, the logic to check his login status should be done in the intent redirection from SplashScreenActivity itself.

Assuming you have tracked the log in status correctly, you activity flow should be like this:

1) SplashScreenActivity->MainActivity (if user is logged in)

2) SplashScreenActivity->SignInActivity->MainActivity (if user is not logged in)

If the user login status is false, he should be redirected to SignInActivity and there in the onclick event of nextButton, his credentials should be verified and then login status should be updated and then he should be redirected to MainActivity.

Within your MainActivity you should allow the user to log out and there, the login status should be updated to false.

I know this doesn't answer your question directly, but many a times such bugs can be eliminated by rethinking the design and making it robust in that level itself.
title: Intent to MainActivity starts current Activity again
